data.title: Kansas Highway Patrol, KS
data.meta_description: Work for the premier law enforcement agency in Kansas. From law enforcement to civilian the Kansas Highway Patrol has a career for you.
data.text:
Kansas Highway Patrol Policy Statement

In accordance with Executive Order No. 19-02 issued and signed by Governor Laura Kelly on January 15, 2019, and all other relevant federal and state statutes, the Kansas Highway Patrol subscribes to the concept of equal employment opportunity.

Anti-Discrimination

The Kansas Highway Patrol is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse and highly qualified workforce and to employment practices which prevent discrimination based on race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability status, marital or family status, genetic information, age, military or veteran status (except when any of these factors is an existing bona fide occupational qualification), or political affiliation (except for certain specified employees in the unclassified service).

Affirmative Action

The Kansas Highway Patrol is committed to an affirmative action policy which includes an assurance that no discrimination will be tolerated based on the above listed protected classes, in employment situations which include, but are not necessarily limited to, hiring, promotion, training, transfer, lay-off, compensation, physical facilities or termination.

All management personnel of this agency shall actively recruit and provide support, mentoring and development programs to ensure equitable representation of disabled, veterans, minority and female persons in all job categories.
